Articles.Content:
I have rovers on several planets and at the moment my Moho rover has gone at least a quarter of the way round the planet on a single mission

 

So

How far have I travelled .....would love to know as it has taken nearly a week in real time

 

And how's about how far each ship has travelled ? ..... Time since launch *yes* ..... but distance *No*

 

Mileometer  . Kilometer readout like in your car please

I believe the word your looking for is odometer.

Also, doesn't the F3 window have something like this?

Edit: Snark might be on to something there...

Edited June 2, 2016 by FungusForge
Actually, this would be a neat idea for a mod.  Have a part whose right-click menu provides lots of "trip info":  distance traveled, average speed, elevation change, yadda yadda.  Reset button.

16 minutes ago, FungusForge said:

I believe the word your looking for is odometer.

Also, doesn't the F3 window have something like this?

 

Just looked at the F3 window ....didn't know it was there

 

Total ground distance *Logged* it says '0'

Total Distance travelled *Logged* it says'0'

 

Actually it is showing the info for the landing cradle which I use to land the rover & not the rovers info

The landing cradle is hundreds of kilometres away from here

 

I know it's the cradles info because it says Max G Force 0.3 G

 

Just checked the Cradles info and it has (it's own info)

 

It has been on Moho for 22 days .....22 days and I have still not reached the missions location ....nearly there though

Edited June 2, 2016 by hurric

Ref: F3

For some reason it has started to show some more info, but it is only showing the info (since) I looked at the landing cradle

 

and the info it is showing ( is only ) the info (directly since) switching back to the rover

I just selected another rover (minmus) and looked at F3

Nothing logged

Moved rover

Logging started

It seems you have to activate F3 on each vehicle to start the log
